title: xss
content:
content on a server is including Javascript content from an unrelated domain. When this script code is fetched by a user browser and loaded into the DOM,
it will have complete control over the DOM, bypassing the protection offered by the same-origin policy.
Even if the source of the script code is trusted by the website operator, malicious code could be introduced if the server is ever compromised.
It is strongly recommended that sensitive applications host all included Javascript locally.
This gives the operator of the server where the code originates control over the DOM, and the web application .
steps: Identify a web application that includes JavaScript content from an unrelated domain.
Observe that the included script has full control over the DOM, bypassing the same-origin policy.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves a web application including JavaScript from an unrelated domain, which can lead to DOM manipulation and bypass of the same-origin policy. This can be exploited if the external server is compromised, allowing malicious code to be injected.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it only requires identifying external JavaScript inclusions and understanding the implications of such inclusions on DOM control and same-origin policy bypass.
